summary: One-page, mobile-first website for the local mobile store "Gadget Zone" (Thiruvanmiyur, Chennai) with a mature, showroom-style design, simple contact actions (Call/WhatsApp/Instagram), plus a minimal educational section near the bottom: “Mobile Care & Smart Usage Guide (2026)” with a numbered facts list and show-more toggle.
architectural_notes: Mobile-first layout suitable for WhatsApp and Instagram sharing.
Use realistic product images only; no illustrations or cartoons.
WhatsApp integration must only open a direct chat to +91 98400 77591 (no automation/backend).
No customer data upload, reminders, automation, or backend systems.
Do not change any other sections, text, layout, or styling beyond the explicitly requested updates.
Sticky bottom action bar must be mobile-only and remain visible while scrolling.

Add an ultra-subtle background texture using thin outline mobile-related icons (smartphone/earbuds/charger/smartwatch) in light grey at ~3–5% opacity, softly scattered and non-distracting (texture, not decoration).
Exception to the 'no sliders/animations' constraint: allow a hero-only image slider with 2–3 slides, using a simple fade transition every 4–5 seconds.
Add an embedded Google Map iframe near the Contact section; map click should open the existing Google Maps link in a new tab/window.
Add a minimal business highlights strip with simple icons for location, hours, call, and WhatsApp; do not alter existing layout/styling outside inserting this strip.

existing_features.title: Create a single, clean one-page website for the mobile store with a mature showroom-style design: neutral/white background, calm typography, minimal text, no flashy elements.

Implement the hero section as a large, full-width banner with only the following text: "Gadget Zone", "Mobiles • Accessories • Service", and "Thiruvanmiyur, Chennai"; include prominent Call and WhatsApp buttons.

Add a “Products & Services” grid displaying exactly 5 clean product-style cards (image + title only): New Mobile Phones, Mobile Accessories, Mobile Service & Repair, Exchange & Upgrade Support, EMI / Finance Options.
Add a Trust section that lists exactly these four simple points: Genuine Products, Reliable Service, Easy EMI Options, Local Store Support.
Add a Contact & Visit section that includes: full address, a map link, working hours, Call button, WhatsApp button (direct chat), and an Instagram icon linking to the provided Instagram URL.
Ensure WhatsApp integration is limited to opening a direct chat to the store number only; do not add any data capture, customer uploads, reminders, automation, or backend systems.
Keep the page strictly simple: do not add animations, sliders, discounts, promotional sections, or any extra sections beyond Hero, Products & Services, Trust, and Contact & Visit.
Apply a coherent, professional visual theme suitable for a local showroom: neutral palette (not blue/purple), calm modern typography, generous whitespace, and consistent spacing across all sections.
Use a placeholder logo for "Gadget Zone" and display it in a clean, minimal way appropriate for a professional retail site.
Use only realistic product photography (no illustrations or cartoons) for the hero banner and the 5 product/service cards, served as static assets from frontend/public/assets/generated.

Replace the current hero banner image with a clean retail-style photo showing mobile phones and mobile accessories, and remove the current sofa image; keep the hero section layout, text, gradient overlay, and Call/WhatsApp buttons unchanged.
Add a brand logo strip immediately below the hero banner that displays muted/grayscale logos for Apple, Samsung, Motorola, Xiaomi, OnePlus, Realme, and Vivo.

Enhance the existing “Why Choose Us” (trust) section by changing each of the four trust items from title-only to include: (a) a clean professional thumbnail/icon and (b) the provided English description text for that item; keep the section heading and overall section styling consistent with the current page.

Add a new “Store Gallery” section containing 3–5 clean image cards showing a mobile showroom/store interior style layout; placeholders are acceptable; the section must fit the site’s existing minimalist showroom aesthetic.

Add a mobile-only sticky bottom action bar that remains visible while scrolling and contains exactly three buttons in this order: Call | WhatsApp | Map; these buttons must use the existing phone number, WhatsApp direct chat link, and Google Maps link already used elsewhere in the page.

Update ONLY the Brand Logo Strip container at XPath /html[1]/body[1]/div[1]/div[1]/section[2]/div[1]/div[1] so the brand logo images appear bigger and more colorful, without changing any other sections of the page.

Replace the Brand Logo Strip image assets currently referenced in frontend/src/App.tsx (brands array) with new color logo files under frontend/public/assets/generated, and adjust the styling in the Brand Logo Strip so the logos are not artificially faded (remove/reduce opacity-60 default).

Add a mature, ultra-subtle background texture across the page using a thin-outline icon pattern (smartphone, earbuds, charger, smartwatch) rendered in light grey at extremely low opacity (3–5%), softly scattered, and non-distracting (should read as texture, not decoration).

Introduce clean section separation by alternating very-light-grey section backgrounds while keeping all cards and content surfaces white for clarity; apply only background color changes to sections (no changes to text, layout, spacing, or content).

Apply the new background texture and section background alternation in a way that preserves the existing one-page structure and behavior (including hero, brand strip, products/services, trust, gallery, contact, footer, and sticky action bar) and does not introduce any new decorative elements beyond the requested subtle texture and light-grey section alternation.

Replace ONLY the image inside the selected element at XPath /html[1]/body[1]/div[1]/div[1]/section[1]/div[2]/div[1] (the hero-section logo container) with the user-uploaded file "Gadget Zone-Logo.png" by adding it as a static asset under frontend/public/assets/generated and updating the src in frontend/src/App.tsx accordingly; do not change any other hero content, layout, text, buttons, or styling.

Convert the existing Hero section in frontend/src/App.tsx into a clean, professional slider with a maximum of 2–3 slides, using only high-quality retail-style photography related to (1) mobile phones, (2) mobile accessories, and (3) mobile service/repair.

Keep the hero overlay content exactly the same on every slide: existing logo image, headings/text, gradient overlay, and the existing Call Now and WhatsApp buttons with their current links and styling.
Implement a slow automatic slide transition (every 4–5 seconds) using a simple fade effect only, with no user controls (no arrows, no dots) and no additional animations beyond the fade.
Do not change any other sections or content on the page beyond the hero image area behavior required to support the slider.
Add the new hero slide image assets as static files under frontend/public/assets/generated and reference them from the slider implementation in frontend/src/App.tsx.

Fix the broken hero logo by ensuring the uploaded file "Gadget Zone-Logo-1.png" is available as a static asset under frontend/public/assets/generated and updating the hero logo in frontend/src/App.tsx to reference "/assets/generated/Gadget Zone-Logo-1.png" instead of the currently-referenced "/assets/generated/Gadget Zone-Logo.png".

Increase the displayed size of the hero logo image element at XPath /html[1]/body[1]/div[1]/div[1]/section[1]/div[2]/div[1]/img[1] by updating only that element’s Tailwind sizing classes in frontend/src/App.tsx (i.e., increase its height on mobile and desktop) without changing its src, alt text, container layout, or any other page elements.

Add an embedded Google Map inside the existing “Contact & Visit” section in frontend/src/App.tsx that shows the store location for the existing address string (KRISHNAMURTHY SALAI, 73 KALKI, Lattice Brg Rd, Thiruvanmiyur, Chennai, Tamil Nadu 600041). The embedded map must be placed near the existing address/map link UI and must be clickable/tappable so that it opens the existing Google Maps link already used on the page (mapUrl).

Add a clean, minimal, professional “business highlights” strip (icons + short text) without changing the current design or layout of existing sections, containing exactly these four items in English: (1) Location: Thiruvanmiyur, Chennai (2) Working Hours: 10 AM – 9 PM (3) Call for Enquiries (4) WhatsApp Support. Use existing icon libraries already used in the project (e.g., lucide-react) and keep styling consistent with the current neutral showroom aesthetic.

Update the existing WhatsApp action(s) in frontend/src/App.tsx to support click-to-chat with prefilled message options, using WhatsApp’s URL text parameter (no automation, no backend). Provide user-selectable options for these exact messages: “Hi, I’m looking to buy a new mobile.”, “Hi, I need mobile service or repair.”, “Hi, I want to know about accessories.” The implementation must remain strictly click-to-chat (wa.me) and must not add any data capture, reminders, or automation.

Add basic SEO metadata by updating frontend/index.html to set: (1) page title to “Gadget Zone – Mobile Store in Thiruvanmiyur, Chennai” and (2) a meta description that mentions mobiles, accessories, service, EMI, and the Thiruvanmiyur, Chennai location (English text).
Update ONLY the anchor element at XPath /html[1]/body[1]/div[1]/div[1]/section[7]/div[1]/div[1]/div[2]/a[1] so that its href points to exactly this URL: https://maps.app.goo.gl/gZZFWDAMTsQW4nkD9.

Update the Google Maps link handling in frontend/src/App.tsx so that all “Map” actions (including the embedded map click overlay and the mobile sticky “Map” button) open exactly this URL in a new tab/window: https://maps.app.goo.gl/gZZFWDAMTsQW4nkD9.

Make the embedded map in the Contact & Visit section render reliably without requiring a Google Maps Embed API key (i.e., do not use an embed URL that depends on an API key that may be restricted), while keeping the embedded map clickable/tappable via the existing overlay link behavior.

In frontend/src/App.tsx, add a new educational section titled “Mobile Care & Smart Usage Guide (2026)” placed near the bottom of the page immediately before the existing Footer. The section must render the provided 25 facts exactly as given as a clean numbered text list (no cards, icons, boxes, emojis, or colored backgrounds). Use a two-column layout on desktop and a single-column layout on mobile. Show only facts 1–8 by default, and include a toggle labeled “Show more” to reveal facts 9–25; when expanded, allow collapsing back (e.g., by changing the same control to “Show less”). Do not modify any existing sections, layout, or styling outside what is required to insert this new section.

Fix the Brand Logo Strip in frontend/src/App.tsx so all brand logos render with a uniform footprint and clean alignment: give each logo the same fixed height and width container, center-align the logo within that container, preserve each logo’s original aspect ratio (no stretching/distortion), and ensure consistent spacing between logos; keep the section visually clean and professional with no background boxes or heavy visual effects.

Update the Business Info / Business Highlights Strip in frontend/src/components/BusinessHighlightsStrip.tsx so the entire icon + text area is clickable for each item, with correct actions and subtle interaction feedback: Location opens the existing Google Maps link used in frontend/src/App.tsx (MAPS_LINK: https://maps.app.goo.gl/gZZFWDAMTsQW4nkD9) in a new tab; Call triggers the phone dialer using the existing phone number (+919840077591); WhatsApp opens a WhatsApp chat using the existing WhatsApp number (919840077591) via click-to-chat (wa.me) only; Working Hours remains informational but still has the same subtle hover/tap feedback. Do not redesign the strip or modify layout/content/styling elsewhere beyond what is required to make the items fully clickable with feedback.

In the Hero section of frontend/src/App.tsx, update ONLY the hero logo rendering so the full logo is always clearly visible (not clipped at the top or bottom) across mobile and desktop. Ensure the logo preserves its aspect ratio and is not cropped by any sizing/overflow behavior.

Make the hero logo image blend with the website background by using a logo asset with a transparent background (or otherwise matching the site background), and update the hero logo in frontend/src/App.tsx to reference the updated static asset under frontend/public/assets/generated.

In the Hero section of frontend/src/App.tsx, update ONLY the hero logo rendering so the entire logo is always fully visible (not clipped/cut off) on both mobile and desktop, preserving the logo’s aspect ratio and preventing any cropping from sizing/overflow behavior.

Make the hero logo background blend with the website background by ensuring the hero logo image asset used in frontend/src/App.tsx has a truly transparent background (no solid box/halo) and updating the referenced static asset under frontend/public/assets/generated accordingly.

Fix the Brand Logo Strip in frontend/src/App.tsx so that the affected brand logos (user reports logos 1,2,3,5,6) are not cut off at the top or bottom. Ensure each logo renders fully within its footprint on both mobile and desktop by adjusting only the Brand Logo Strip container and image sizing/fit styles (do not modify other page sections).
